#### Section 39. Emergency Medical Evacuation due to COVID-19
In the event You are Diagnosed with for COVID-19 and if judged by Our appointed assistance company that it is medically appropriate to move You to another location for medical treatment or to return You to Singapore, Our appointed assistance company shall arrange for the mode of evacuation, based on the medical severity of Your condition and We shall pay such expenses incurred, up to the Benefit Limit.

You and the persons acting on Your behalf will be required to provide details of insurance such as name, identification / passport number, Policy number, etc..

This Section is not applicable to Insured Person(s) who are above the age of eighty (80) years old.
questions: How does the policy define the process and conditions under which emergency medical evacuation due to COVID-19 is arranged, including the role of the appointed assistance company and the determination of medical appropriateness?

What documentation and personal information must the insured or their representatives provide to the insurer or appointed assistance company to facilitate emergency medical evacuation due to COVID-19?
How does the policy limit coverage for emergency medical evacuation expenses related to COVID-19, and what is the significance of the Benefit Limit in this context?
In what ways does the insured person's age affect eligibility for emergency medical evacuation coverage due to COVID-19, specifically regarding the exclusion for those above eighty years old?

How might the policy's general exclusions interact with the emergency medical evacuation due to COVID-19 section, particularly if the insured's condition is related to pre-existing conditions or other excluded causes?
If the insured is diagnosed with COVID-19 but the appointed assistance company deems evacuation medically inappropriate, how does this affect coverage and claim eligibility under this section?

What are the implications for emergency medical evacuation coverage if the insured is diagnosed with COVID-19 but refuses to provide required insurance details such as policy number or identification?
How does the policy address scenarios where the insured requires evacuation to a location other than Singapore for medical treatment due to COVID-19, and what conditions govern such arrangements?
What is the role of the appointed assistance company in selecting the mode of evacuation, and how does the medical severity of the insured's condition influence this decision?
How does the exclusion of insured persons above eighty years old from this section affect claims if such a person requires emergency medical evacuation due to COVID-19?

In cases where the insured is evacuated back to Singapore for COVID-19 treatment, how does the policy coordinate with other medical expense or follow-up treatment sections, and what documentation is required?

How does the policy ensure that expenses incurred for emergency medical evacuation due to COVID-19 are reasonable and medically necessary, and what oversight does the appointed assistance company have?
What happens if emergency medical evacuation costs exceed the Benefit Limit specified in this section, and how does this affect the insured's out-of-pocket expenses?

How does the policy handle emergency medical evacuation claims if the insured's COVID-19 diagnosis occurs during a trip that is subject to other policy exclusions, such as travel advisories or publicly known events?

If the insured is diagnosed with COVID-19 but is asymptomatic or has mild symptoms, how might this affect the appointed assistance company's judgment on the necessity of evacuation and subsequent coverage?
How does the policy address the timing of evacuation arrangements following a COVID-19 diagnosis, and are there any time limits or notification requirements to qualify for coverage?

What are the responsibilities of persons acting on behalf of the insured in providing insurance details and coordinating with the appointed assistance company for emergency medical evacuation due to COVID-19?
How does the policy define 'medically appropriate' in the context of emergency medical evacuation due to COVID-19, and what standards or guidelines might the appointed assistance company use?
Are there any specific exclusions or limitations within this section that override general policy exclusions, particularly regarding age or medical severity criteria?
How does the policy coordinate emergency medical evacuation due to COVID-19 with quarantine requirements or government-imposed travel restrictions that may affect the insured's movement?
